page.title: 02THE BICTON AREA
page.content: { } The area around Bicton is mostly farmland,with some deciduous woodland and a few small settlements. { } A farmer in the area was interviewed.His farm,Bicton Farm,consists of 250 acres which support 160 pedigree Fresian cows with their calves, and also 30-40 sheep and 2 lambs.The family have owned the farm for 21 years and have 1 labourer, their nephew, who lives in a cottage on the farm.The outputs from the farm are silage and a little hay which are mainly for their own use.They also produce milk,but the amount produced will have to be reduced as the E.E.C. milk quota will affect them.A tributary of the River Severn runs through the farm and this means the soil,which is sand and clay,is damp.
